fields.description:
There are several options for implementing this:

1) start in read-only mode, have an "edit properties" option in the actions menu. This is old-school. 
2) start in read only mode, support in-line editing of individual properties. This is the way we really should be doing this, but it's a significant amount of work and should be scoped as a feature request. FR GUI-998 has been opened to track that request. 
3) disable action buttons (save changes, add tag, add rule, add user etc) button when there are no changes that need to be saved. enable button only when there are changes. would be good also, if there are values entered in a rule or user or tag and the user hasn't clicked the add button for that thing, could we pop up a message that they need to do that as part of this fix, please? [~jloza] to provide a message for this, ask when ready.

(side note: browser should be notifying you if you change focus from this tab or page and unsaved changes exist. This is not happening, need to fix that. GUI-997 has been opened for that). This is what the team recommends we do, in 4.0.1. T SHIRT SIZE (INCLUDING TEST EFFORT) MEDIUM

Additionally, we may need to make the fact that changes were saved more obvious to users. GUI-999 has been opened to track that request, but as part of this work, we could at least increase the amount of time success growls are open before dismissing them, which is trivial amount of work and would be helpful.
fields.summary: On detail pages, it is hard to know when my changes have been saved

comments.body: please implement option 3 for the fix.

Pull request is created for review:

https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/750

Only on the volume detail page for now.

It enables Save Changes button when the name is updated or tags has been added or removed. However, it won't detect whether the changes made are resulted in the identical values as the original, for instance, change the volume name back to the original value will still remain the Save Change button enabled.
It also appears that CSS work needs to be done to clearly distinguish the disabled Save Changes button.

Updated pull request at:

https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/753

Rather than trying to compare the updated values with the original, the Save Changes button will be enabled whenever change events or other custom events get triggered. 

The pull request above shows the implementation for all resource detail pages, with the Save Changes button, for review.

For code review on 

https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/753
[~kyolee]: See https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/755 for a (perhaps) cleaner approach to handle this.

[~kgill] Just checked out the branch. It's definitely much cleaner approach since using the ng attributes, but the issues that I was seeing for the security group page were that the Save Changes button gets enabled even before any change is actually made; for instance, just having to type a key on the tag inputbox would enable the Save changes button immediately. I will leave it up to [~jloza] to weigh on how the behaviors should be.

Also the security group automated test has failed:

http://10.111.4.12/job/Koala-SUITE/204/

It's due to the issue that the test tries to create a new security group with no rules, however the Create Security Group button does not get enabled since no rules or tags have been added.

[~kyolee]: Ah, your point on enabling the Save Changes button when the tag input field is focused on is well taken.  On your second comment, I'm surprised we have a test that creates a security group with no rules.  Is that expected?

[~kgill] For the second comment, the issue is that the Save Changes button and Create Security Group button are under the same HTML button tag on the template, which is shared between the create page and detail page of the security group.

Notice what I have done in this pull request https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/753

is that the buttons were separated and only the Save Changes button was put under "ng-disabled" attribute. And, similar changes will be needed for other resource pages as well.
[~kyolee] Your approach in pull request 753 offers a better UX than the approach I tried in PR 755 . Will review your PR and test a bit more before merging.

[~kyolee]: I noticed detail pages that allow Name tag edits were not properly enabling the Save Changes button when the Name field was edited.  Pushed a commit to fix that in https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/commit/ce7b7aa526496f

Were you going to implement the Save Changes disabled state for the image detail page in pull request 753, or will that be in a separate pull request?

[~kgill] Initially 'keyup' was used to trigger the event, however after examining the interaction, the keyup would trigger the event even when arrow keys were typed, which technically didn't change the input value. So, later switched to 'change' event instead, which would only trigger the event when the input value is actually altered.

I've tested it on Chrome and Firefox, and it worked correctly on both. I can try to double-check again.

And, for Image detail page, I thought there was no Save Changes button, but just found out there was. I will update the pull request after verifying the case above.

In addition to the comment above, just learned that for the 'change' event, the user needs to be clicked out of the input box in order to the event to be triggered, thus have the Save Changes button enabled. And, for the 'keyup' event, the downside is that the event will be triggered on any keypress, such as arrow keys. It could work either way. Any suggestion, [~jloza]?

[~kyolee]: Looking at http://stackoverflow.com/questions/6458840/on-input-change-event , seems we should be binding to the 'input' event -- made the change in commit https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/commit/87e9c3e4

[~kgill] Pushed a commit that added the disable/enable Save Change button to the image detail page, which was tested on Chrome and Firefox. Ended up creating a JS file for the image detail page.

And, the 'input' event looks good on Chrome and Firefox as well.
Pull request 753 merged.  Assigning to [~jloza] for UX review.

Nice work! Couple of comments:

* Disabled buttons should be gray, not faded orange please. 
* there is no message provided when the user has entered (for example) a tag and didn't click add tag. In that case, a modal box should display that says "You must click the "Add" button before you submit this for your <tag or user or rule, depending on where this occurs> to be included."
[~jloza]: Are we sure we want a tag save warning modal?  Seems fairly disruptive IMO.  Are we planning on having a "don't show me this again" checkbox on that modal?
[~kgill] yes, we need it. It's a behavioral change from 3.4.x that has already confused people. No do not show again needed, they need to learn it.
[~jloza] [~kgill] so, do we want a modal box to drop with a warning message when the Save Changes button is clicked and the tag is not saved?
Yes.

[~jloza] Pull request has been created for UX review:

https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/759

the unsaved tag warning modal is added to the volume detail page and the security group detail page.

[~kyolee] looking good, more comments:

The add (user|tag|rule) button should also be grayed out until there is a change made that enables it, please. 

Also, I am running branch 795-fix, but I don't see the modal if i navigate away and have an unsaved tag on the volume detail page. Am I doing something wrong?

[~jloza] the warning dialog would only show up when the Save Change button is clicked. 

We will need to investigate the way to have the modal show up when the user tries to navigate away from the page by clicking other links, which could be more complicated, but I'm not sure if we could prevent the case where the user clicks away using the browser's built-in navigation button.

[~jloza] Pull Request

https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/759

has been updated to include the unsaved tag issue when navigating away from the volume and security group pages.

And, the create volume and security group pages have been updated to disable the "Create" button when the required input fields are missing, which is related to the ticket,

https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/browse/GUI-1046
Oh you're right, I forgot there's a separate jira ticket for that. We can work on that then.
Awesome!!!

[~jloza], [~kyolee], [~alice]: I'm pretty nervous about disabling the Create button on create pages via JS.  We already have Foundation validation doing the right thing there, and introducing a bunch of JS code to disable the Create ____ button on the create resource pages significantly increases the QA burden and dramatically increases the chance of regressions.  We haven't tested the changes thoroughly across our supported browsers, and who knows if the stuff will still work if/when we upgrade our versions of AngularJS and Foundation.  

I strongly recommend we only add the disabled button feature for resource edit pages, not for the create pages.

I can't comment on jira, but user testing indicates we need buttons disabled until the form is ready to submit, like we did in 3.4.x. 

Surely you can figure out some genius way to achieve this with the architecture we have? Our architecture needs to be able to support the UX requirements for the console.

Will comment in jira later when I can access it.
Forgot to add all.

[~jloza] I'm not referring to whether or not we *could* do this, I was referring to if we *should*.  Meaning, while the architecture supports anything we want to implement, we should be diligent about what features we implement and how we implement them. 

The title of this ticket indicates the work should be scoped to the resource detail (read: edit) pages, and I'm happy to see the save changes button disabled there.  However, adding a bunch of code to extend it to the create pages is going too far IMO.  It's just too much code to maintain, code we don't need since Foundation's validation is already doing the right thing by not allowing the forms on the create pages to be submitted if validation fails.

The issue regarding the create resource page has been discussed on the ticket,

https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/browse/GUI-1046

Sorry about mixing the fixes together on the same branch. I could separate the fixes for selective merge if needed. Please let me know what needs to be done.

Thank you all!
[~kyolee] Yes, please keep the branches for GUI-795 and GUI-1046 separate to avoid confusion.

A new pull request is created for the UX review:

https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/764

, which removed the GUI-1046 related fix from the previous GUI-795-fix branch.
Also, learned that the navigate away on the unsaved changes issue was filed on the ticket GUI-997.
Yep, thanks, just fix the detail pages for this ticket, there's another one for the create stuff.

UX Review pending at:

https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/764

[~kyolee] save changes button enablement/disablement works well on volume detail page. Nice job! I am kicking this back to you to implement that on all the pages, please, or whatever needs doing. 

What about disabling the add button for rules|users|tags until something is entered there, that still needs doing please...should work the same way you did the save changes disablement.
[~kyolee], [~jloza]: Before we continue working on this, we should test what we've implemented so far on Internet Explorer (versions 10 and 11).
Sounds prudent. I just checked on Chrome...we should also be sure it works on FF.
[~jloza][~kgill] I've verified it on Chrome and FF on OS X. I do not have Internet Explore handy, so I'd appreciate if one of you could let me know on how it worked on IE. Thank you!
Awesome, thanks [~kyolee]! I am pretty sure [~kgill] has IE?

Pull request at:

https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/768

for UX review on all detail pages.

However, I've learned that some of the implemented features here might not work on FF.
[~kyolee]: Could you be more specific about what features may not work on Firefox?

The 'beforeunload' handling seems to be inconsistent on Firefox, for instance, I've noticed that when a tag is specified and the user tries to click away from the page, the FireFox browser might not trigger the warning message. Will need to further investigate this issue.
[~kyolee]: Why is the beforeunload work done here?  It should be done on GUI-997, correct?

[~jloza]: After a phone sync-up [~kyolee] and I agree that the work to show the alert when navigating away from the page with unsaved changes should be implemented in GUI-997.  Kyo will pull out his GUI-997-related changes from the GUI-795 PRs and will open a new PR for GUI-997 when implemented.
Thanks, [~kgill] and [~kyolee]. That's perfect. Let's keep each fix with its associated ticket. Y'all rock!

[~jloza] [~kgill] Pull request is created for this ticket:

https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/769

, which only contains the disable/enable button fixes.

OK, [~kyolee], this work seems incomplete in the 795-split branch which seems like the one I should be reviewing based on the comments in the jira ticket. 

I have included some comments below, but stopped reviewing because there seemed like so much unfinished work. I thought you were completing this ticket for all the detail pages? If that is not the case and I should only be reviewing a small subset of pages, please let me know. Otherwise, please fix the things I have listed below, and make sure this is implemented for *all* the detail pages, and then I will review it again. Thanks!

* The modal that pops up when you try and submit and have an unsaved tag or rule or user is too vague...it should specifically say
You must click the "Add Tag" button before you submit this for your tag to be included. (or Add Rule for your rule to be included, etc), please. We need to be as specific as we can, so people know exactly what to do. 
* the unsaved tag modal does not display on the instance detail page when you are adding tags to a stopped EBS instance. 
* the unsaved tag modal does not display on the instance page for instance-store either. 
* the unsaved tag modal does not display on the scaling group detail page

[~jloza] The pop-up modal is only implemented on the volume detail page and the security group detail page. Currently it says,

"You must click the "Add" button before you submit this for your tag to be included."

And for the instance detail page and the scaling group detail page, the fix must have been left out when the branch was split. Will add the fixes soon.

OK thanks [~kyolee]. As mentioned in the team meeting today, just putting here to keep track, the text of the modal needs to be made more specific about what resource you are talking about, like this:

"You must click the "Add Tag" button before you submit this for your tag to be included." (or Add Rule for your rule to be included, etc).

Pull request has been reopened at:

https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/769

This branch contains the fixes that are following:

 - for all detail pages, including IAM user and group pages,
   -- When a key is pressed on inputbox, or an option is selected on dropdown, the Save Changes button gets enabled.
   -- When a tag, a rule, or a user is added, or deleted, the Save Changes button gets enabled.
   -- Once the Save Change button is enabled, it won't get re-disabled, which is a side-effect, rather than a desired feature.
   -- If a tag is typed, either key or value, but not added, a warning modal will show up when the Save Changes button is pressed.
   -- If a security group rule is described, but not added, a warning modal will show up when the Save Changes button is pressed.
verified UX is as designed, for instance pages. Assuming this is implemented on all detail pages, if not please open individual bugs for those pages.

[~kyolee]: Per item above "If a tag is typed, either key or value, but not added, a warning modal will show up when the Save Changes button is pressed."  I tried this on an instance detailed page and it did not work as described.  I modifed the name of the instance and then typed in some text in the tag fields but did not click the "Add tag" button.  I then clicked "Save Changes" and did not see an error message that I did not add the tag.  Instead the instance was saved with the new name but it did not include the new tag values.  Should I have received a warning modal instead?  Tested with build: eucaconsole-4.0.0-0.0.468.20140606gitc323a3aa.el6.noarch.

[~ccassler] You should've seen the warning modal in that case, which currently worked on the latest develop branch when built from source. This fix was merged 2 days ago. Do you see the warning modal at all in other pages? Trying to find out whether the package included the fix.
[~kyolee]: I have not seen the modal on other pages.
[~ccassler] It might be the case that your UI package installed is not up-to-date. Is there a way to check when the package was prepared?
[~kyolee]:  I'm not sure how to do this.  I will have to research and update the bug.
[~kyolee], I did try this on both FF and Chrome and I got the same results.

[~ccassler] This fix does not depend on browsers, so my guess at this point is that the UI package you are testing with must be outdated. Try the latest package, and please let us know if you see the same issue again.

[~kyolee]:  Here is the package info I have.  From what you mentioned earlier, it looks like it does not include the fixed code.  I will re-verify this when I have an updated version.
{code}
